title: Mastering Confidence Scores
description: Learn how to interpret confidence scores and improve your requests for better results. Understanding confidence is key to effective ComBadge usage.

steps.title: Understanding Confidence Scores
steps.description: Confidence scores tell you how certain ComBadge is about understanding your request. Scores range from 0-100%, with higher scores meaning better understanding.

steps.title: Creating a Low Confidence Request
steps.description: Type a vague request to see low confidence in action: 'I need a car sometime'
tips: No vehicle ID, date, or time specified
ComBadge will struggle to understand this

steps.title: Analyze the Vague Request
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' and observe the low confidence score that results from the vague request.
tips: Notice the confidence score is likely below 50%
The AI reasoning shows what information is missing
Red confidence indicators warn about low reliability

steps.title: Identifying the Problems
steps.description: Look at the AI Analysis panel. ComBadge will highlight what makes this request unclear: missing vehicle ID, no specific time, vague purpose.
tips: No specific time ('sometime' is too vague)

steps.title: Improving the Request
steps.description: Now type an improved version: 'Reserve vehicle F-123 for client meeting tomorrow 2pm to 4pm'
steps.expected_value: Reserve vehicle F-123 for client meeting tomorrow 2pm to 4pm

steps.title: Analyze the Improved Request
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' to see how the improved request achieves much higher confidence.
tips: Notice the confidence score is now likely 90%+
Green confidence indicators show high reliability
All required information is clearly extracted

steps.title: What Affects Confidence?
steps.description: ComBadge confidence depends on several factors. Let's explore each one:
tips: Clarity: Clear action words (reserve, schedule, check)
Context: Previous requests can provide context

steps.title: Testing Specificity
steps.description: Try this medium-specific request: 'Reserve a sedan for Friday afternoon meeting'
steps.expected_value: Reserve a sedan for Friday afternoon meeting
tips: Vehicle type specified (sedan) but not ID
Time frame given (Friday afternoon) but not exact

steps.title: Analyze Medium Specificity
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' to see how partial specificity affects confidence.
tips: Some information is clear, some is ambiguous

steps.title: Building Context
steps.description: ComBadge remembers context within a session. First, ask: 'What vehicles are available tomorrow afternoon?'
steps.expected_value: What vehicles are available tomorrow afternoon?

steps.title: Analyze Context Query
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' to process the availability query and establish context.
tips: This should have high confidence (clear question)
Context is now established for follow-up

steps.title: Context-Aware Follow-up
steps.description: Now make a context-aware request: 'Reserve the sedan for my meeting'
steps.expected_value: Reserve the sedan for my meeting

steps.title: Analyze Context Follow-up
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' to see how context improves understanding of the vague follow-up.
tips: Confidence should be higher than without context
ComBadge fills gaps from previous interaction

steps.description: Here are proven strategies to consistently achieve high confidence scores:
tips: Use specific vehicle IDs (F-123, not 'the car')

steps.title: Practice: Improve This Request
steps.description: Here's a low-confidence request to improve: 'Fix the truck'. Rewrite it for high confidence using what you've learned.
tips: What kind of fix? (Specify service type)
Example: 'Schedule brake repair for vehicle T-456 next Tuesday'

steps.title: Final Practice Analysis
steps.description: Click 'Analyze' to test your improved request and see if you achieved high confidence.

steps.title: Confidence Mastery Complete!
steps.description: Excellent work! You now understand how to read confidence scores and improve your requests. Use this knowledge to get better results from ComBadge.
tips: Use context to build conversational flow
